Package gbuild.menu

Class GMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • gbuild.GComponent
      • gbuild.GPanel
        • gbuild.menu.GMenu
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HorizontalGMenu, VerticalGMenu
    public abstract class GMenu
extends GPanel

    Menu formed by a set of options

    This is the implementation of a menu that contains lots of options that are clickable and are associated to a key value which actives an event.

      • add

        public void add​(GComponent component)
        Description copied from class: GPanel
        Add a component to current panel

        Panel won't allow repetitions on elements, so it is not possible to include two elements which are the same. If you want to include repetitions, create a new instance or change the clone method of the component.

        Talking about the addition, if a component is included on the panel, the position and dimension of it would be updated so that all components are truly inside the area of the panel.

        In future revisions, the panel would incoporate a way to customize if it will allow repetitions. Besides, we will improve the update of the location and dimensions of the panel, since it is possible that developers use the panel as a container with no location and dimension

        Overrides:
        add in class GPanel
        Parameters:
        component - graphical component
        See Also:
        GPanel.updateComponents()

      • draw

        public abstract void draw()
        Description copied from class: GComponent
        Draw component on the screen

        This method would drawn the component taking into account all the customization done before.

        It is important to notice that component would not be drawn if visible state is not true.

        Overrides:
        draw in class GPanel
        See Also:
        GComponent.isVisible()
